intro: Cipura martinicensis, commonly known as the Martinique cipura, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wet, tropical environments and is often found in marshy areas or near water. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
